SensorReading.title: SensorReading
SensorReading.description: Represents a single sensor reading with its value and timestamp.

id.description: Unique identifier for the sensor reading.

value.description: The value of the sensor reading. The unit depends on the current configuration of the BioThrust dashboard.

timestamp.description: The timestamp of when the sensor reading was recorded, in ISO 8601 format.

SensorConfiguration.title: SensorConfiguration
SensorConfiguration.description: Represents the configuration settings for the sensor, including mode, unit, and custom values.

id.description: Unique identifier for the sensor configuration.

mode.description: The display mode of the sensor (RAW, VOLTAGE, CUSTOM).

unit.description: The unit of measurement for the sensor (e.g., RAW, V, bar).

minValue.description: The minimum value for the sensor in custom mode.

maxValue.description: The maximum value for the sensor in custom mode.

arduinoVoltage.description: The reference voltage for the Arduino in voltage mode.

LeakAnalysis.title: LeakAnalysis
LeakAnalysis.description: Represents the result of a leak analysis performed on sensor data.

id.description: Unique identifier for the leak analysis.

analysisModel.description: The analysis model used for leak detection (linear_leak, nonlinear_leak).

startThreshold.description: The start threshold value for the leak analysis.

endThreshold.description: The end threshold value for the leak analysis.

sensitivity.description: The sensitivity value (RÂ²) used for the leak analysis.

result.description: The result of the leak analysis (e.g., Leak Likely, Diffusion Likely).

analyzedRange.description: A description of data range that was used when running the leak analysis tool.

Product.title: Product
Product.description: Represents a product that can be tested.

TestBench.title: TestBench
TestBench.description: Represents a physical test bench where tests are conducted.

id.description: Unique identifier for the test bench.

name.description: The name of the test bench.

location.description: The physical location of the test bench (e.g., Lab A, Room 101).

description.description: A brief description of the test bench's capabilities.

id.description: The user's unique ID, matching their Firebase Auth UID.
Unique identifier for the ML model.

description.description: A brief description of the model.

fileSize.description: The size of the model file in bytes.

TestSession.title: TestSession
TestSession.description: Represents a single test session for a product.

id.description: Unique identifier for the test session.

productId.description: The ID of the product being tested.

testBenchId.description: The ID of the test bench where the session occurred.

sensorConfigurationId.description: The ID of the sensor configuration used for the session.

userId.description: The ID of the user who initiated the session.

startTime.description: The start time of the test session.

endTime.description: The end time of the test session.

status.description: The status of the session (e.g., RUNNING, COMPLETED, SCRAPPED).

firestore.reasoning: To ensure an unblocked and seamless development experience, the security rules are configured to be completely open for any authenticated user. A single, universal wildcard rule `match /{document=**}` grants full read and write access (`get`, `list`, `create`, `update`, `delete`) to every collection and document in the database for any user that is signed in (`if request.auth != null`). This approach eliminates all permission-related errors during development and is suitable for a rapid prototyping environment. For a production environment, these rules would need to be replaced with more granular, restrictive rules that enforce data ownership and roles.
